citation.article-title: Reclassification of 'Blastobacter viscosus' 7d and 'Blastobacter aminooxidans' 14a as Xanthobacter viscosus sp. nov. and Xanthobacter aminoxidans sp. nov.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Xanthobacter aminoxidans sp. nov.
Xanthobacter aminoxidans (am.in.ox′i.dans. N.L. n. aminum amine; M.L. v. oxido make acid, oxidize; N.L. part. adj. aminoxidans amine-oxidizing).
Gram-negative pleomorphic rods, 0·8–1·0×1·5–3·5 μm, apparently branching to form V-shaped cells.
Non-motile.
Reproduction occurs by asymmetric division (budding) of the mother cell to produce a shorter daughter cell.
Colonies are yellow, round, convex, bright, non-transparent, smooth-surfaced, with an even edge, homogeneous and of slimy consistency.
In liquid medium with methylated amines or glucose the cells do not produce exopolymer.
The temperature range is 5–34 °C, optimum 29–32 °C, and the pH range is 6·5–8·5, optimum pH 7·2–7·8.
Obligately aerobic, but potentially, microaerophilic.
Catalase-, peroxidase- and oxidase-positive.
Urease, phenylalanine deaminase and arginine dihydrolase are not produced.
Indole is formed from l-tryptophan.
Reduces nitrates to nitrites.
With glucose medium, acid and gas are not produced.
Utilizable carbon sources are monomethylamine, dimethylamine or trimethylamine, ethanol, butanol, mannitol, xylose, glucose, raffinose, glyoxylate, fumarate, malate and lactate.
Utilizable nitrogen sources are ammonium salts, nitrates, peptone, methylated amines and some amino acids.
Fixes N2 when grown in nitrogen-deficient media.
Grow autotrophically in an atmosphere of H2+O2+CO2 and on methylamines by the key Calvin-cycle enzymes phosphoribulokinase and ribulosebisphosphate carboxylase.
Trimethylamine and methylamine are oxidized by the appropriate dehydrogenases and dimethylamine is oxidized by monooxygenase (NADH or NADPH).
The major ubiquinone is Q-10.
The major fatty acid of peptone-yeast extract-glucose agar-grown cells is C18 : 1 (76·0 %).
The major phospholipids are phosphatidylcholine, phosphatidylethanolamine and phosphatidylglycerol.
The G+C content of the DNA is 69·1 mol% (Tm).

The GenBank accession number for the 16S rRNA gene sequence of strain 14aT is AF399969. X. aminoxidans strain 14aT was isolated from activated sludge of a sewage-purification system at the Baikal paper mill, Russia.
The type strain, 14aT, is deposited in the All-Russian Collection of Microorganisms as VKM B-2254T and the American Type Culture Collection as ATCC BAA-299T.
